{"step_by_step_thinking": "Dimorphic fungi are fungi that can exist in two forms - yeast and mold, depending on the temperature. P. marneffi, Histoplasma capsulatum, and Blastomyces dermatitidis are all examples of dimorphic fungi. However, Pneumocystis jirovecii is not a dimorphic fungus. It exists primarily as a yeast form.", "answer_choice": "D"}
